TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class Character : Java.Lang.Object, IConvertible, IDisposable, Java.IO.ISerializable, Java.Lang.IComparable

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Character extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ISerializable, class Java.Lang.IComparable, class System.IConvertible, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: The wrapper for the primitive type char.

remarks.para: The wrapper for the primitive type char. This class also provides a number of utility methods for working with characters.

Character data is kept up to date as Unicode evolves. See the Locale data section of the Locale documentation for details of the Unicode versions implemented by current and historical Android releases.
The Unicode specification, character tables, and other information are available at .

Unicode characters are referred to as code points. The range of valid code points is U+0000 to U+10FFFF. The Basic Multilingual Plane (BMP) is the code point range U+0000 to U+FFFF. Characters above the BMP are referred to as Supplementary Characters. On the Java platform, UTF-16 encoding and char pairs are used to represent code points in the supplementary range. A pair of char values that represent a supplementary character are made up of a high surrogate with a value range of 0xD800 to 0xDBFF and a low surrogate with a value range of 0xDC00 to 0xDFFF.
On the Java platform a char value represents either a single BMP code point or a UTF-16 unit that's part of a surrogate pair. The int type is used to represent all Unicode code points.

Here's a list of the Unicode character categories and the corresponding Java constant, grouped semantically to provide a convenient overview. This table is also useful in conjunction with \p and \P in .
Cn Unassigned
Cc Control
Cf Format
Co Private use
Cs Surrogate
Lu Uppercase letter
Ll Lowercase letter
Lt Titlecase letter
Lm Modifier letter
Lo Other letter
Mn Non-spacing mark
Me Enclosing mark
Mc Combining spacing mark
Nd Decimal digit number
Nl Letter number
No Other number
Pd Dash punctuation
Ps Start punctuation
Pe End punctuation
Pc Connector punctuation
Pi Initial quote punctuation
Pf Final quote punctuation
Po Other punctuation
Sm Math symbol
Sc Currency symbol
Sk Modifier symbol
So Other symbol
Zs Space separator
Zl Line separator
Zp Paragraph separator

Docs.param: the code point for which to calculate the number of required chars.
Docs.summary: Calculates the number of char values required to represent the specified Unicode code point.

remarks.para: Calculates the number of char values required to represent the specified Unicode code point. This method checks if the codePoint is greater than or equal to 0x10000, in which case 2 is returned, otherwise 1. To test if the code point is valid, use the method.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int CodePointAt (Java.Lang.ICharSequence seq, int index);
.method public static hidebysig int32 CodePointAt(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence seq, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: the source sequence of char units.
the position in seq from which to retrieve the code point.
Docs.summary: Returns the code point at index in the specified sequence of character units.

remarks.para: Returns the code point at index in the specified sequence of character units. If the unit at index is a high-surrogate unit, index + 1 is less than the length of the sequence and the unit at index + 1 is a low-surrogate unit, then the supplementary code point represented by the pair is returned; otherwise the char value at index is returned.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.
if the index is negative or greater than or equal to the length of seq.

remarks.para: Returns the code point at index in the specified array of character units. If the unit at index is a high-surrogate unit, index + 1 is less than the length of the array and the unit at index + 1 is a low-surrogate unit, then the supplementary code point represented by the pair is returned; otherwise the char value at index is returned.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.
if the index is negative or greater than or equal to the length of seq.

Docs.summary: Returns the code point at index in the specified array of character units, where index has to be less than limit.

remarks.para: Returns the code point at index in the specified array of character units, where index has to be less than limit. If the unit at index is a high-surrogate unit, index + 1 is less than limit and the unit at index + 1 is a low-surrogate unit, then the supplementary code point represented by the pair is returned; otherwise the char value at index is returned.

Docs.param: the source sequence of char units.
the position in seq following the code point that should be returned.
Docs.summary: Returns the code point that precedes index in the specified sequence of character units.

remarks.para: Returns the code point that precedes index in the specified sequence of character units. If the unit at index - 1 is a low-surrogate unit, index - 2 is not negative and the unit at index - 2 is a high-surrogate unit, then the supplementary code point represented by the pair is returned; otherwise the char value at index - 1 is returned.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.
if the index is less than 1 or greater than the length of seq.

Docs.param: the source array of char units.
the position in seq following the code point that should be returned.
the index of the first element in seq.
Docs.summary: Returns the code point that precedes the index in the specified array of character units and is not less than start.

remarks.para: Returns the code point that precedes the index in the specified array of character units and is not less than start. If the unit at index - 1 is a low-surrogate unit, index - 2 is not less than start and the unit at index - 2 is a high-surrogate unit, then the supplementary code point represented by the pair is returned; otherwise the char value at index - 1 is returned.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.
if the index <= start, start , index is greater than the length of seq, or if start is equal or greater than the length of seq.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int CodePointCount (Java.Lang.ICharSequence seq, int beginIndex, int endIndex);
.method public static hidebysig int32 CodePointCount(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence seq, int32 beginIndex, int32 endIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: the inclusive index to begin counting at.
the exclusive index to stop counting at.
Docs.summary: Counts the number of Unicode code points in the subsequence of the specified character sequence, as delineated by beginIndex and endIndex.

remarks.para: Counts the number of Unicode code points in the subsequence of the specified character sequence, as delineated by beginIndex and endIndex. Any surrogate values with missing pair values will be counted as one code point.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.
if beginIndex , beginIndex > endIndex or if endIndex is greater than the length of seq.

remarks.para: Counts the number of Unicode code points in the subsequence of the specified char array, as delineated by offset and count. Any surrogate values with missing pair values will be counted as one code point.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.
if offset , count or if offset + count is greater than the length of seq.

MemberSignature.Value: public static char ForDigit (int digit, int radix);
.method public static hidebysig char ForDigit(int32 digit, int32 radix) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the character which represents the specified digit in the specified radix.

remarks.para: Returns the character which represents the specified digit in the specified radix. The radix must be between MIN_RADIX and MAX_RADIX inclusive; digit must not be negative and smaller than radix. If any of these conditions does not hold, 0 is returned.

Docs.summary: Unicode category constant Cf.

Docs.param: the Unicode code point to get the directionality of.
Docs.summary: Returns the Unicode directionality of the given code point.

remarks.para: Returns the Unicode directionality of the given code point. This will be one of the DIRECTIONALITY_ constants. For characters whose directionality is undefined, or whose directionality has no appropriate constant in this class, DIRECTIONALITY_UNDEFINED is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string GetName(int32 codePoint) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a human-readable name for the given code point, or null if the code point is unassigned.

remarks.para: Returns a human-readable name for the given code point, or null if the code point is unassigned.

As a fallback mechanism this method returns strings consisting of the Unicode block name (with underscores replaced by spaces), a single space, and the uppercase hex value of the code point, using as few digits as necessary.

Examples:
Character.getName(0) returns "NULL".
Character.getName('e') returns "LATIN SMALL LETTER E".
Character.getName('٦') returns "ARABIC-INDIC DIGIT SIX".
Character.getName(0xe000) returns "PRIVATE USE AREA E000".
Note that the exact strings returned will vary from release to release.

Docs.exception: if codePoint is not a valid code point.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int32 GetNumericValue(char c) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the numeric value of the specified Unicode character.

remarks.para: Returns the numeric value of the specified Unicode character. See .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int32 GetNumericValue(int32 codePoint) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the numeric value of the specified Unicode code point.

remarks.para: Gets the numeric value of the specified Unicode code point. For example, the code point 'Ⅻ' stands for the Roman number XII, which has the numeric value 12.

There are two points of divergence between this method and the Unicode specification. This method treats the letters a-z (in both upper and lower cases, and their full-width variants) as numbers from 10 to 35. The Unicode specification also supports the idea of code points with non-integer numeric values; this method does not (except to the extent of returning -2 for such code points).

Docs.summary: Returns true if the given code point is a Unicode whitespace character.

remarks.para: Returns true if the given code point is a Unicode whitespace character. The exact set of characters considered as whitespace varies with Unicode version. Note that non-breaking spaces are not considered whitespace. Note also that line separators are considered whitespace; see for an alternative.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int OffsetByCodePoints (Java.Lang.ICharSequence seq, int index, int codePointOffset);
.method public static hidebysig int32 OffsetByCodePoints(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence seq, int32 index, int32 codePointOffset) cil managed

Docs.param: the character sequence to find the index in.
the number of code points to look backwards or forwards; may be a negative or positive value.
Docs.summary: Determines the index in the specified character sequence that is offset codePointOffset code points from index.

remarks.para: Determines the index in the specified character sequence that is offset codePointOffset code points from index.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.
if index , index is greater than the length of seq, or if there are not enough values in seq to skip codePointOffset code points forwards or backwards (if codePointOffset is negative) from index.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int OffsetByCodePoints (char[] seq, int start, int count, int index, int codePointOffset);
.method public static hidebysig int32 OffsetByCodePoints(char[] seq, int32 start, int32 count, int32 index, int32 codePointOffset) cil managed

Docs.param: the character array to find the index in.
the inclusive index that marks the beginning of the subsequence.
the number of char values to include within the subsequence.
the start index in the subsequence of the char array.
the number of code points to look backwards or forwards; may be a negative or positive value.
Docs.summary: Determines the index in a subsequence of the specified character array that is offset codePointOffset code points from index.

remarks.para: Determines the index in a subsequence of the specified character array that is offset codePointOffset code points from index. The subsequence is delineated by start and count.

Docs.exception: if seq is null.

if start , count , index , index > start + count, start + count is greater than the length of seq, or if there are not enough values in seq to skip codePointOffset code points forward or backward (if codePointOffset is negative) from index.

This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig char[] ToChars(int32 codePoint) cil managed

Docs.param: the Unicode code point to encode.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified Unicode code point into a UTF-16 encoded sequence and returns it as a char array.

remarks.para: Converts the specified Unicode code point into a UTF-16 encoded sequence and returns it as a char array.

Docs.exception: if codePoint is not a valid code point.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int ToChars (int codePoint, char[] dst, int dstIndex);
.method public static hidebysig int32 ToChars(int32 codePoint, char[] dst, int32 dstIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: the Unicode code point to encode.
the destination array to copy the encoded value into.
the index in dst from where to start copying.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified Unicode code point into a UTF-16 encoded sequence and copies the value(s) into the char array dst, starting at index dstIndex.

remarks.para: Converts the specified Unicode code point into a UTF-16 encoded sequence and copies the value(s) into the char array dst, starting at index dstIndex.

Docs.exception: if codePoint is not a valid code point.
if dst is null.
if dstIndex is negative, greater than or equal to dst.length or equals dst.length - 1 when codePoint is a .

MemberSignature.Value: public static int ToCodePoint (char high, char low);
.method public static hidebysig int32 ToCodePoint(char high, char low) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts a surrogate pair into a Unicode code point.

remarks.para: Converts a surrogate pair into a Unicode code point. This method assumes that the pair are valid surrogates. If the pair are not valid surrogates, then the result is indeterminate. The method should be used prior to this method to validate the pair.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig char ToLowerCase(char c) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the lower case equivalent for the specified code point if it is an upper case letter.

remarks.para: Returns the lower case equivalent for the specified character if the character is an upper case letter. Otherwise, the specified character is returned unchanged.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.Character ValueOf(char c) cil managed

Docs.param: the char value for which to get a Character instance.
Docs.summary: Returns a Character instance for the char value passed.

remarks.para: Returns a Character instance for the char value passed.

If it is not necessary to get a new Character instance, it is recommended to use this method instead of the constructor, since it maintains a cache of instances which may result in better performance.
